page.title: 01Duns Tew and North Aston
page.content: Rolling countryside, intensively farmed except in the stream bottoms. Mostly arable wheat and barley, smaller areas of grass carrying cattle and horses. one small coniferous wood, but well treed hedgerows, including recent plantings. The area is cut in two by the busy north south A423 Oxford/Banbury trunk road. Duns Tew lies to the west with 2/3 of the land, largely a residential village, but with 3 farms in the village, a kitchen furniture maker and a compost/turf dressing manufacturer. One farm converted to holiday flats. Population 430. North Aston lies to the east wholly residential with a population of about 100.
